comments.body: Should there be a version number for `numpy`? I seem to remember that if I didn't have a version, the built packages ended up being built against a particular numpy ABI.

Please correct me if I am wrong but siphon does not seems to have any compiled code against numpy so that is not necessary.

Note that we can add it anyways. The default channel does that for all package.  It would be done by adding `numpy x.x` as a dependency.  However, that has the downside of bloating the channel, by creating many packages like `pack-py{versions}-np{versions}`, and using more CI time than needed.

BTW the numpy version range is in the CI configuration. See https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/blob/master/scripts/run_docker_build.sh#L56 for an example.
That was precisely the point. Back when I made MetPy's recipe, unless I put in the numpy version (the `>=`), I ended up with packages pinned to a particular numpy ABI. It was really weird.
